We mounted maxswerve wheels properly, but when we turn the wheels by hand, they sometimes turn very hard and get stuck, sometimes they turn very easily.

WhatsApp Görsel 2023-02-05 saat 16.45.331500×2000 170 KB

WhatsApp Görsel 2023-02-05 saat 16.45.331500×2000 185 KB

Stucks","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55087,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/maxsverve-doesnt-turns-properly/425839/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3140003,"name":"Michael DeVinney","username":"half_ton_hero","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/half_ton_hero/{size}/154276_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-05T14:28:52.429Z","cooked":"

Here are a few things to check:

There are a few gears that if installed upside down will cause the module to bind. Double check the assembly instructions and make sure the gear matches the drawing for each step. We have assembled 8 of these modules and the students only got it right 50% of the time, even on repeat attempts! If I were to guess, this might be your issue from your description.

Additionally, if you accidently touch the 550 housing while attempting to turn the module, it will cause the module to seize. Be sure your hand or surface isn’t touching the 550 housing when attempting to turn.

We haven’t heard of any issues here on Chief Delphi regarding binding of Max Swerve, but it could be a similar scenario to the Max Planetary 90 degree gear box posted here: MAX90 degree gearbox update 1/21/23 - YouTube

I would explore the first two options before exploring the third.

I hope this helps!
